Title: Object: Green spectacles or consular goggles!!
Description: Napoleon sits full face on a rock inscribed 'Usurped Power' and rising steeply from the sea. His eyes are covered by a green bandage between grotesque artificial eyes or disks from which rays slant down covetously to points in the sea. These are: (left) 'Great Britain', a small adjacent rock, 'West Indies', on the horizon, and (right) 'Malta', 'Egypt' [two pyramids], 'East Indies' on the horizon. He sits with elbows on knees an wears a huge cocked hat, and uniform with large epaulets and sword. c. June 1803 Hand-coloured etching
Curator's comments: (Description and comment from M.Dorothy George, 'Catalogue of Political and Personal Satires in the British Museum', VIII, 1947) On the eve of war Napoleon had made demonstrations against the West Indies, Egypt (and therefore India), Great Britain; see BMSat 9998. For Malta see BMSat 9997, &c. Broadley, i. 177.
Bibliographic references: BM Satires / Catalogue of Political and Personal Satires in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum (10004)
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
